metadata.title: CVE-2022-29581 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.description:
Improper Update of Reference Count vulnerability in net/sched of LinuxKernel allows local attacker to cause privilege escalation to root. Thisissue affects: Linux Kernel versions prior to 5.18; version 4.14 and laterversions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29581` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-113-generic - 5.4.0-113.127
linux-image-5.4.0-113-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-113.127
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-113-generic - 5.4.0-113.127
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-113-lowlatency - 5.4.0-113.127
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-44-generic - 5.13.0-44.49~20.04.1
linux-image-5.13.0-44-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-44.49~20.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-113.127').
